div.sent: Those who have faith in God and those who are single-minded, their prayers are always heard.
Our Lord Jesus Christ also said.
Whatever you ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.
But it is not enough just to ask of the Father.
One has to have deep faith in one's heart.
Sometimes our prayers are answered and other times not.
Whenever we ask of God something and we don't get it, we think that God does not hear our prayers.
So we don't feel like praying.
In this way many people often stop praying.
But one should never do that.
Many times we may ask for something, but it may not be good for me.
Prayer is essential for the well-being and prosperity of my own self, my family, the society and the country.
The family that prays lacks no peace.
In a country whose citizens are not indifferent to religion, there will be no chaos.
Therefore, in our life's journey we have to have faith in God.
He will provide all necessary help to overcome all dangers.
The person, family or the country that trusts in God does not face any dangers.
King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylonia had captured Jerusalem and carried away some young men as prisoners.
Daniel was one of them and he was a Jew, of the tribe of Judah.
After the death of Nebuchadnezzar, his son Belshazzar became the king of Babylon.
He had no fear of God.
He used to live in great luxery.
God was very displeased with him.
One day he was assassinated.
Then Darius became the king of Babylon.
In order to administer his kingdom properly, he decided to appoint a hundred and twenty governors to hold office throughout his empire.
In addition, he appointed three persons to supervise the governors.
Daniel was one of these three.
He was a pious and God-fearing man.
For this, King Darius loved and respected Daniel.
So the king considered putting him in charge of the whole empire.
When the supervisors and the governors came to know the king's plan, they became jealous of Daniel.
So they began to find fault with him.
But Daniel was always very faithful.
So their many attempts to find fault with him failed.
They began to conspire against him.
All the supervisors, the governors, the lieutenant-governors, and the other officials of the Babylonian kingdom conspired together.
Anyone violates this order is to be thrown into a pit filled with lions.
They had this order signed by the King, for a mere verbal proclamation would not have the force of the law.
Arrangements were made to make the order equally applicable to the Medes and Persians.
In all simplicity the king consented to their wishes and signed the Decree.
Daniel came to know that the king had signed this Decree.
Still he continued to pray to God three times a day and sing his praises kneeling at a open window facing Jerusalem.
His enemies were waiting just for such an opportunity.
They watched him closely and noticed that Daniel was praying as usual and praising God.
So they went to the king and reminded him about the Decree.
They said to the king, Your Majesty, Daniel does not respect you and the order issued by you.
He prays to his God regularly three times a day.
When the king heard this, he was upset and did his best to find some way to rescue Daniel.
The Persians too are bound by the same law.
So the king, seeing no other way to save Daniel, gave permission to throw him into the pit filled with lions.
The king said to Daniel, May your God, whom you serve so loyally, rescue you.
You know that jealousy or envy is a vice.
Jealousy lead to the thought of murder.
But killing someone is a grave sin.
The Fifth Commandment says it clearly, Do not kill.
When someone knowingly and freely kills another person, he commits a murder.
The high officials of Babylon did precisely this.
They wanted to kill Daniel so that they could occupy his position and win the King's favour.
But the king was sad thinking that he would lose someone so wise as Daniel and this would mean a great loss for the nation.
Moreover, Daniel was innocent.
And yet, the king did not use his authority as the ruler.
Envy, anger, hatred, etc. are sins.
Envy and anger vitiates the atmosphere of the heart.
It is a sin to nurture hatred and spirit of revenge.
It is a sin to hate someone.
The Bible says, Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that a murderer has not got eternal life in him.
Hence we must avoid the sins of envy, anger and hatred.
Through self-control, appreciation for others qualities, tolerance for others, love and spirit of forgiveness we can avoid this sort of sinful tendencies.
We should not envy anyone for his good works and status.
Envy begets a spirit of revenge, and even grave sins like murder.
If we remain close to God through prayer and self-control, then we can overcome envy, greed, anger, hatred, etc.
In the previous lessons we learned that the Babylonians were worshipers of many gods and goddesses.
But Daniel believed in the Lord God and offered prayers and praises to him along.
For this reason he was thrown into the pit of lions.
In this lesson we will see how Daniel's faith in God was rewarded.
We will learn how God saved Daniel from the mouths of the lions.
King Darius had Daniel thrown into the pit of the lions in order to be faithful to the royal Decree.
But he had said to Daniel, May your God, whom serve so loyally, rescue you.
We can interpret this statement of his as an expression of his faith.
King Darius was very sad when Daniel was thrown into the pit of the lions.
He spent the whole night in his palace fasting, he touched nothing of luxury.
He could not even fall: asleep the whole night.
The following morning he got up early went near the pit of the lions.
This proved that he had faith in God.
Daniel replied to the king, May Your Majesty live for ever!
God sent his angel to shut the mouth of the lions so that they would not hurt me.
He did this because he knew that I was innocent and because I have not wronged you, Your Majesty.
When king Darius knew for sure that Daniel's God had saved him from the mouths of the lions, he was overjoyed.
He gave orders for Daniel to be pulled up out of the pit-He was pulled up and there were no wounds on his body.
For he trusted God firmly.
So God saved him.
Before they even reached the bottom of the pit, the lions pounced on them and broke all their bones.
For the lions were very hungry.
Then king Darius wrote to all the people of his kingdom, Peace be with you !
I command that throughout my empire everyone should fear and respect Daniel's God.
For he is a living God, and he will rule for ever.
His kingdom will never be destroyed, and his power will never come to an end.
He saves and rescues; he performs wonders and miracles in heaven and on earth.
He saved Daniel from being killed by the lions.
How infinite is God's mercy.
He is Almighty.
By his own power he saved Daniel from the mouths of the hungry lions.
Why did he save him ?
Because worshipped the one and only God.
Daniel used to pray to God every day in humility and on bended knees.
He was not afraid of anyone, and he remained firm in his faith in God.
The officials had conspired to throw him into the pit of the lions because he prayed to God.
They thought the lions would devour him.
But he was not afraid.
We should never be ashamed of giving witness to Christ in public.
God is Almighty, he is All-powerful.
We will always depend on him.
God gives us his blessings if we persevere in prayer.
